Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julian C
Reviews.Content: Staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. Slightly diffcult to find if you travelling by train. Location is great to blue mosque, topkapi, basicllica cistern and tram amongst others. Hard to find faults, higly recommended. Internet is very good and on all the time.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel nice location”
Reviews.Author: rebecca m
Reviews.Content: stayed in april for two nights, paid 130 euro for a double room. travelled to hotel from sabiha gokcen, didn't do our research well and assumed airport transfer should be easy as istanbul is such a big tourist city, heyho how wrong we were. the sabiha airport was miles away in the asian side of city and the hotel was in european side. the hotel emailed me and offered private transfer for 75 euro per car (up to 4 people) per journey. it was very pricey for just two people so we opt for public transport. so we took bus E10 (5 TL) then ferry crossed bosphorus (2 TL) then tram to sirkeci (2 TL) then train to cankurtaran (2 TL) then a 15 mins walk to find the hotel, took over 2 hours but cost only 11 TL, bit nightmare. we did try to look for taxi when arrived in the port on the european side, but two taxi drivers told us they didn't know the hotel and politely declined our business. silly us, should just use the airport shuttle to go straight to the european side then find a taxi or something. we did really enjoyed the ferry ride, highly recommended but maybe not dragging all the luggages. anyway, the hotel located within a short walk to the historic part, there were many restaurants that opened till late. check in and out were both smooth and fast. our room was tiny but enough. bed was comfortable, shower was strong and good, bathtub was a bit high to get in and out so some people may need help for that. our room was facing the street so occasionally there were a bit traffic or late drinkers noise but didn't last more than a few seconds. the prayer calling was loud but we found the sound calming and relax so all good. the hotel decor was very ornated and beautiful. breakfast was good and plenty of healthy options, we were late and staff were very patient and accommodating. bewared of in room beverage charge, that's include the tea and coffee facility, tea bag 1 TL and coffee sachet 2 TL. we paid the hotel TL instead of euro when checking out, be prepared of a slightly higher exchange rate but acceptable. on our return journey to airport, we found a couple of airport transfer shops located just a few blocks away from the hotel, on the way to blue mosque, cost 10 euro per person, pick up from hotel, drop off airport shuttle station in european side, price included ticket of airport shuttle (12 TL). this worked really well and efficient, no hassle at all. overall it was a lovely hotel, reasonably price and superb location. almost forgot to mention the lovely seafront pomerade walk just 2 mins from hotel, very good stroll after breakfast or dinner. the roof top terrace can see the sea and really lovely just to sit down to chill for a while when the sun is out, even when the roof top bar was closed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mevert
Reviews.Content: The overall experience at Aruna was disappointing for the price. There is no restaurant, contrary to what was indicated on the site we booked through. Neither was the roof terrace accessible. Breakfast was served, but in a windowless dining room below ground level. The breakfast included no fresh fruit juice, to me a basic quality standard. The room was rather shabby and small for a what was sold as a `deluxe` room. The bathtub was blocked. A visit to the hotel`s `hammam` was included in the price. However, when we asked to visit, it was not heated up nor was the pool filled up. Massages given by the cleaning lady would have been charged extra. What was also irritating was the policy of constantly trying to sell more clearly over-priced additional services, tours, etc. On the whole, a bit of a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-nice staying”
Reviews.Author: Kyberos
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel, we had a pleasant stay, our room was big and very clean.In a great location ,near to most Historical sites of Istanbul.The stuff was very friendly , nice and spoke very good English to help us out where to go.The breakfast was great with a lot of options and very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “good, clean boutique hotel.. nothing fancy.. but value for money!”
Reviews.Author: KazimKirmani
Reviews.Content: Aruna Boutique Hotel is sure value for money. It has around 25 rooms I guess, which means you will hardly see any people. The decor is well done, yet not too expensive. Unlike a budget hotel where it is usually white-wash with basic facilities, this hotel scores better in this regard. The main desk is always manned; and the staff are well versed in English and very friendly too. The hotel has a deal with one of the local limo service provider, and hence to-and-fro services to either the main city airport (Ataturk) or the one on the outskirts (Sabiha) is economical and you don't have to break your head explaining the location to the driver. They also guide you well to tourist locations, and the ferry services and the finer details of it all. The hotel locality is a quiet area of the old city, Sultanahmet and is only a 10-15 minutes walk from major tourist areas. You can go the Sultanahmet Square, the Blue Mosque, The Basicila Cistern, The Grand Bazaar and other areas of tourist interests all on foot. There is a railway station nearby, and if you walk 10 minutes to the Sultanahmet Square, you can also get on the local tram to take you far away. The breakfast was kind of nice, and they had a good spread. The rooms aren't too huge, but sufficient enough for you store your luggage well and stretch your legs around. The room we stayed in was a double and it was clean and nice, and we also had a balcony opening to one of the crammed streets of the old city. They also provide free Wi-Fi, which is a plus if you want to reconnect with the world outside. All in all.. a good place for backpackers and/or couples looking for a quick stopover in Istanbul. We saw only one couple with kids there, so not sure how good it would be for someone with kids, given the small size of rooms that we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Good Location and excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Tinacamen
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at Aruna Hotel, the staff spoke very good english and they were very helpful, the location is excellent, the old city is only 5 minutes away and there is a nice promenade walk just 2 minutes away. The breakfast couldn't be better, with boiled eggs, fruit nuts and excellent coffee. We also tried the sauna which was really nice. The only thing we missed was that the restaurant was closed in the evening, but there is plenty of take aways around the corner. We will definitely stay in the same Hotel when we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “With a few changes this could be a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wolfe_Photography
Reviews.Content: This hotel could be better than it is. We arrived and found that the larger room we had paid for was not available so we got a smaller room with barely enough room to put our luggage on the floor and be able to walk around. After one day, we were moved to a larger, nice room. Our beds in both rooms had no top sheet and the blanket was too small for the bed. We often had to make adjustments in the middle of the night so we could share the blanket and not having a top sheet was very uncomfortable. The bottom sheet was pressed but looked soiled. This was true even after they had changed the bottom sheet (remember no top sheet). Light bulbs were out but replaced after a call. There was no stopper in the sink. Fortunately, we always carry a flat rubber stopper as we often experience leaking sinks. There was only one glass in the bathroom, in both rooms and several calls requesting an additonal glass made no difference. It was also difficult to get into the shower as it was a shower/tub combination that had very high sides. We were on a busy street so we couldn't open the windows and the air conditioning blew right on the bed area. The breakfast area was on the roof. Normally, this would be a pleasant place for breakfast but it was cold and the rain was coming in. Too bad as the breakfasts were quite nice. The internet was very good and worked in our rooms. The manager was pleasant but the other staff did not communicate well. The Aruna is a boutique (small) hotel that could be so much nicer if the easy to change improvements could be made. It is in a good location and close to the Armada Hotel, where we spent our time to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, clean, safe”
Reviews.Author: bfloating
Reviews.Content: Nothing exciting but certainly adequate. Location is very good for playing in Old Town. Convenient to The mosques, Grand Bizarre, Spice Market and Whirling Dervishes. Reasonably priced, free breakfast, decent service and CLEAN. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Arnua Hotel - Great!”
Reviews.Author: teagan716
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aruna Hotel in August 2011. We had upgraded to a room with a sitting area. The room was big, the bed comfortable, and very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a close walk to the town square. Highly recommend the hotel. It is a small hotel with maybe 10 rooms. It also had a nice breakfast included in price.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate Charm in the Heart of a Bustling City”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: This little hotel, in the heart of the Old City, brings charm, comfort, and intimacy that exceeded our expectations. From the rooftop breakfast overlooking the Golden Horn to the room that seemed more like a little apartment to the friendly, helpful staff, we found this to be a most pleasant time that we were sorry to have to end. Istambul itself is a must for any traveler (and we did not have any idea what to expect), and the Aruna Boutique Hotel was situated in a perfect location to experience the city.

Reviews.Title: “Would return again”
Reviews.Author: sunred10
Reviews.Content: Located in a quiet neighborhood street in old Istanbul. Close to great restaurants and major sites including the Arasta Bazaar. Our room was spacious and very clean. When my husband asked about internet connections, he was given a laptop to use in our room! There are two terraces overlooking the Bosphorous - great for relaxing. The area has small winding streets and it took us a while to learn our way back to the hotel. We suggested that the hotel give out more detailed maps to guests. The staff saw this as a positive recommendation. Everyone was friendly and professional and willing to go the extra mile to make our vacation even more enjoyable. Would recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “cozy but noisy and not very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Roula_jo
Reviews.Content: - We stayed for 8 nights at this hotel, the most I like is the perfect location since it's between the sea and the historical places such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Top Capi Palace that needs 10 minutes walking distance. - The other positive thing is the friendly staff which you feel at home. - The most annoying thing is the terrible noise from the outside and inside, I could hear the snoring from the next room and any chatting or footsteps inside the hotel, plus the sound of cars, tram and people chatting from the street which waked me up several times at nights and made me having struggle in getting to sleep! - As for the rooms, they are so tiny but if for a single person I think it's quite enough, but what really bothered me is the level of cleanness especially the bathroom which I found not acceptable...the sink was dirty for 2 days in a row that made me inform the housekeeper to clean it (though I was leaving a daily tip expecting to return to a clean room and bathroom) and another day the toilet was not clean which made me real upset and thought this price seems to give this standard of cleaning, even the towels are old and sometimes smelly:( - There is free WI FI in the lobby and rooms, the breakfast is ok, the ac was excellent, a mini bar and a safe inside the small closet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ionut_Catalin
Reviews.Content: I booked 8 nights on this hotel from 21th up to 28th of august 2011 . The first 2 nights we stayed in room 101. I believe this is the smallest room from the entire hotel. During the night there was a sound coming from the bathroom that kept us from resting. I believe it was due to the sewerage from the hotel. After many request we changed the room to 304. This room was much better from the 101 room. Still durring the day, there is an incredible loud sound of the train passing by near the hotel and there is the sound of the cars passing by the hotel as well. Breakfast was good. The minus here was the lack of fruits. The only fresh fruit was the melon. On overall description is average. Big minuses -- on the, rooms(size of it, sounds durring the night) Big pluses -- the location. It is in a 10 minutes walking distance from HAGIA SOPHIA, BLUE MOSQUE, TOPKAPI PALACE, BASILICA CISTERN, HIPODROM.

Reviews.Title: “"A great experience and we will be back !"”
Reviews.Author: Barrievanzyl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is value for money all the way ! The staff are professional and always there if needed. The room and bathroom is very beautiful and practical. The meals in the restaurant on the loft were well prepared and with a beautiful view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bloukrans
Reviews.Content: This Hotel we can really recommend! The staff is very nice and they offerd us a three bed room even we had booked a two bed room. The great thing is the roof top and the breakfast time up there. The great view!. Our flight was at night and we could stay longer in the room. Instead of checking out at 12 o'clock we could keep the room until 3pm. That was really cool!!. Thanks to all the staff. Great location and very close to sightseeing places to walk within 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & terrific value!”
Reviews.Author: thewanderers21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aruna Hotel at the end of May 2011 and were really pleased with our choice. The location is perfect. Tucked in the western side of Sultanahmet, it's close to great restaurants and ideally situated for sights like Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, Basilica Cistern and Topkapi Palace. Our room was finished to a high standard and included a good breakfast. The staff was terrific, friendly and really helpful suggesting restaurants, giving directions, etc.

Reviews.Title: “"extremely helpful staff, makes your stay enjoyable"”
Reviews.Author: anoopkm
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, close to sights, walkable distance to the Blue Mosque. We were received warmly by an entusiastic and helpful staff. They helped us with the do's and don't when shopping (especially carpets), organized the sightseeing at reasonable rates, and were available to answer questions all the time. Wonderful breakfast and service.

Reviews.Title: “Quality time at Aruna Hotel in the heat of the old Istanbul city"”
Reviews.Author: AdiBanu76
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed a lot spending a week at Aruna Hotel in Istanbul...in the heart of the old city. Very nice and comfortable accommodation conditions, great service and great location....and budget rates. Do keep in mind this hotel next time you travel to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect accommodations”
Reviews.Author: rjg123
Reviews.Content: Only 12 rooms in this boutique hotel. It is very very quiet. The rooms are spacious and well cared for. The staff is courteous and extremely helpful. The breakfast is lovely and managed by an older gentleman that is meticulous in the preparation and layout of the meal. The location is perfect for exploring the city on foot and is convenient to the Tram also. The perfect place!

Reviews.Title: “Caution Beware Room 101!”
Reviews.Author: nickminkley
Reviews.Content: On arrival they did not have the rooms that we requested ready so we were told that our friends would be upgraded to a junior suite the following day and we would be upgraded the same the day after. Our friends were put in room 101 which was a tiny box room and we were put in a fairly reasonable one which we were happy with. The following day we assumed that our friends would be moved, but no they decided to move us instead with no consultation and without us packing our belongings and and left our friends in the broom cupboard! After much complain we finally got our friends moved to a decent sized room the following day and we were both happy with our final rooms except for the smell of damp in our room and the noise of the cats from the adjoining courtyard. We were however given a bottle of wine each as compensation. What did annoy us however was the fact that the hotel probably assuming that we were not happy and would look for alternative accommodation took the full amount due from the debit card we used to secure the booking,on the 2nd. day of our stay without any consultation. I have never known any hotel do this before and it caused us to be needlessly overdrawn on one of our accounts It stated clearly on the terms and conditions of booking that payment was to be made at the end of the stay. The other error they made was in the airport transfer that the hotel arranged on our behalf at considerable cost ( 70 euros each way) the shuttle arrived late and then proceeded to take us to the wrong airport when luckily we realised what was happening and made our flight by the skin of our teeth! On the plus side the breakfast buffet was very good and most of the staff very attentive but maybe need a bit more customer training.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Hotel in a Wonderfull City”
Reviews.Author: AlinaMoscow
Reviews.Content: We spent wonderfull 5 days in Aruna Hotel. When we arrive to hotel we spent 1 hour at the reception to get information. They are giving huge information about city and facilities. They gave us city map which shows all the historical buildings. They got us ready to visit city with full information. It was so helpful. If you need they are giving you notebook to use for free !!

Reviews.Title: “The best choice in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Gamtrolia
Reviews.Content: We went there at low season and we have a very pleasant 5-days stay here. The staff and manager are all great and truly helpful. Manager even give us a free upgrade to suite and that was grougrous! They even helped us to buy some turkish delight for souvenir (great quality and very cheap price) A turk friend come to hotel to find us, and hotel boss even give him a free ride back home. It does show how great their hospitality are!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: tmeko
Reviews.Content: I would never thought that it's possible to find a hotel room in Istanbul for about 40 euros, at least not a clean one. But Aruna was a surprise: it was clean, no bugs or anything, very close to main attractions. Taxi driver had some trouble to find it first, as it is situated on a very small street, but we got there quite fast. Receptionist was very friendly and helpfull. I expected something really aufull as the price was so cheap, but it turned out to be not bad at all. As long as you just looking for a place to sleep and not a 5-star hotel, it's more than fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: wvargez
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit and we enjoyed our stay at the Aruna Hotel. The staff were quite welcoming and ready to assist always. The room was very spacious and exceptionally clean. The breakfast was good and we had no difficulty getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money in central position”
Reviews.Author: muora
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel very late and were lucky to get a room, as it proved to be excellent value for money. The location is a step away from blue mosque, meaning a very short walk to all the central sights but still away from traffic, so we had an excellent night's sleep. Room was tiny but comfy, with minibar and aircon (although we didn't need that in November), and the bed provided a good night's sleep. Bathroom was clean and shower worked well. The best part, tho, was the breakfast. It was plentyful and very varied - even after four mornings I still hadn't tasted everything on offer! Besides the usual buffet stuff, you get an omelette, which was spiced slightly with chili powder, very good.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in the city center”
Reviews.Author: valentina4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at Aruna Hotel in Istanbul. It is perfectly located at Sultanahmed district at the old Instanbul - several minutes walk from The blue Mosque and Haga Sofia. The staff of the hotel is very friendly and helpful. The hotel rooms were clean and the berakfast is good. It is a very good value for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Place is slightly above average”
Reviews.Author: AlmostGreek
Reviews.Content: Decent but not extravagant. Slight above average.

Reviews.Title: “You wouldn't want to miss it!”
Reviews.Author: christianna-j
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to start, the rooms and hotel overall is very clean with very good services. If any problems were to occur, someone would attend to your needs asap. The location is great, very central. I definitely got more than i expected at such a reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for its money”
Reviews.Author: Perepel
Reviews.Content: Great value for its money. Definitely recommended for tourists who don't want to pay excess money for the same service. Three minutes walk from sea shore (Kennedy cad.). Ten minutes walk from Sultanahmet Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and the tramway. Rooms are clean, staff is polite and obliging. Lot of small restaurants/cafes/souvenir shops nearby. The breakfast isn't the best, but you will not starving any way.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel..convenient location to all sights”
Reviews.Author: xnadiax
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Aruna Hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful, from checking us into our rooms, to booking a Bosphorus tour. I was expecting the rooms to be small, but the size was almost to American standards. Rooms and bathroom were clean, and overall the hotel was nicely decorated. They have free pickup from the hotel. It was great after a long flight to have someone take us to the hotel. They have a free breakfast buffet on the rooftop every morning, with a nice variety of cheeses, breads, cereals, eggs. My only complaint was that the free wifi wasn't working for about 1 1/2 days at the beginning of our one week trip. The hotel was also a less than 10 min walk to all the major sights. I wasn't sure what to expect with a small boutique hotel I found online, but luckily I ended up liking Aruna and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - convenient location in sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Mike1Paris
Reviews.Content: Good hotel close to the blue mosque. Avoid rooms on the ground floor. Breakfast served on the roof terrace.(summer time)

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTravex
Reviews.Content: the room was clean and spacious , staff were attentive and gracious , rooms and hotel very clean , view from roof top fablous , that was where breakfast was served as well as evening meals , in summer , spring

Reviews.Title: “A memorable honeymoon and a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: B7tripper
Reviews.Content: I spent days researching hotels from the latest Lonely Planet guide for Istanbul. After looking up almost every option listed in that book, I saw that Aruna (which is not featured in LP) had gotten many good reviews on Trip Advisor. I decided to take a chance and chose to stay at the Aruna, and I am glad that we did! After too many bad experiences booking hotels and flights through third party sites online, I sent an email directly to the Aruna and received a reply in a matter of minutes. After a few back-and-forth emails, I received a call from the manager and booked a room over the phone. I was even given a price discount on the Junior Suit due to a price miscommunication online...which was very gracious of them. The driver from the hotel met us at the airport and took us straight to our hotel where we were met by a very friendly staff person. Even though our room was not ready, we were allowed to change clothes and freshen up in a vacant room. Our room was not facing the street and was on the third floor (I would agree with other posters that the first floor facing the street could possibly be a bit noisy from street traffic). Our room was spotless, charming, and blissfully quiet. As far as the hotel's location, I think it is perfect. It is far enough off the beaten track that you get all of Istanbul's charm, without any of the tourist traffic or noise. It took us only 10 minutes of a very easy walk to get to the Blue Mosque. The weather in late Sept is great and we walked everywhere from our hotel, even to the Grand Bazarre. Our only mild quibble is that the terrace view is not the most spectacular around. But frankly, who spends time in a hotel when there is so much more to see? Also, breakfast selection was not the most amazing (far too many sugary cereals for my taste), but it was certainly adequate. The lobby could also be a bit cleaner. Dishes and used cups were sometimes found at the computer station and coffee table. Not a big deal, but also not the best first impression when walking into a hotel. My advice to future customers is to contact the hotel directly when trying to book a room and be sure that, if possible, you get a room not on the first floor, and facing the back of the hotel to eliminate the occasional street noise. Overall, happy that we stayed at the Aruna and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good, missing a few things that would make it better.”
Reviews.Author: Abuelo
Reviews.Content: We arrived midmorning on Sunday even though check in time was scheduled for the afternoon. Greeted nicely and upgraded to a suite on 3rd floor which was immediately available. Elevator holds three people. Old fashioned brass/gold lock with traditional skeleton type key. Luggage brought up. No explanation about air conditioning or tv or jacuzzi. AC is controlled by a remote but no one told us about it so I used the controls on the AC unit itself. Neat window shades controlled by beaded cord. Jacuzzi tub small and difficult for these senior citizen bones to get in and out of. Shower head is the kind that you can hang up or use as a hand shower. Never did learn how to run water in the tub except through putting the shower head down in the tub itself. Plenty of hot water. Storage was limited but sufficient for my wife. My stuff stayed in suitcase on floor. Bed was comfortable and clean. The sheet and cover ( not bed spread) were same size as the bed so that you either slept next to each other for both to be covered or one was at least partially out from under the sheet. It made for togetherness. Safe was in wardrobe, but no explanation about how to access it etc. Had both a key and a number pad. Learned how to use it by trial and error. Room was quiet overlooking an inner courtyard. In summary, the room was clean and good but the failure to explain about AC, safe, shower etc would have made it better. Breakfast was served on the terrace. Multiple bowls with a variety of cereals, dried fruits, cold cuts, good breads, olives etc. Hard boiled eggs, jams, honey, jelly, butter. various cheeses. There were pancakes (rectangular with folded ends that were essentially cold). The attendant would put them in the microwave to heat up. I made ham and cheese pannini sandwiches in the electric grill that was there for that purpose. With the number of guests and the time for breakfast from 8:00 to 10:30 according to the handwritten sign, it would have been easy for them to cook the eggs to order.That would have made the breakfast better from our standpoint. Scarfs were available to put around shoulders if it was too chilly. Orange juice(?) tasted like Kool aide. Coffee was brewed to order and was excellent.. View from the main terrace was open only about 90 degrees but looking to the Bosporus and was okay. There was an additional terrace above the main one and it had a good view but only one table and more windy. The restaurant was closed two nights without any warning or announcement. This was no doubt due to Ramadan. But still there should have been a sign downstairs to that effect or we should have been told. The meal we had there was fine. It was disappointing to walk back to the hotel, being tired, looking forward to another good meal to find out that it was closed. so better communication would have made the experience better. A good thing is that the short walk 5 - 10 minutes from the hotel up to the Blue Mosque/ Sophia etc. is uphill. So when you are tired and coming back it is down hill. The walk itself is interesting with the narrow streets, the cars passing within inches of you, the variety of shops, businesses, hotels, people etc. The street in front of the hotel was so narrow that a bus that was to pick us up for a trip to the Prince's Islands had to wait a block away. Internet access is available in lobby at no charge. Had to ask questions to understand the Turkish key board. Staff was quick to help. When it came time to print out boarding passes, the night man on duty was most helpful. The printer is at his desk, we used his computer and he did the typing with input from me. For some odd ball reason, I was never able to access my email while there but others did not have that difficulty. Staff did a good job in arranging transportation and making tour reservations. The tour to Prince's Islands was okay but overpriced. Could have done better by taking tram to ferry, ferry to big island. Price would have been a lot less. In summary, I think the cost/benefit ratio was good. Some things could have been done better, more professionally, but what was done was in a friendly accommodating manner. I have marked the blank that I would not recommend this to a friend. That is unfair. It depends so much on the friend and the expectations. There is certainly much to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location ,really big rooms”
Reviews.Author: chriskats
Reviews.Content: Very well located, near Sultanahmet square & Cancurtaran train station (to Eminonu). Very big rooms (with wonderful bed & furniture), bathroom with bathtub.They must imrpove the quality of the breakfast and the look of the terrace.If they manage to redecorate the terrace then it will be a great choice fro accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “COSY”
Reviews.Author: Aggekiki
Reviews.Content: perfect location to stay. very nice hotel, full of facilities .... amazinf stuff, full of surprises !!!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a very convenient spot in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: forgcot
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay in the Aruna Hotel. The hotel is lovely and in a good location. We were in a downstairs room next to reception. It was well decorated with all the amenities you could want but it was very small and quite dark. We did not find it noisy and sleep, for the most part, was good. Breakfast on the upstairs terrace is great with a good choice. All in all a great little hotel but next time would insist on an upstairs room.

Reviews.Title: “We Love Aruna -- have dinner on the Terrace!”
Reviews.Author: OCanadah
Reviews.Content: Aruna hotel is truly a gem in the Sultanhmet district. We arrived after (4) long flights and a driver from the hotel picked us up from the airport (free of charge) with a large obvious name sign right at the exit from customs. On arriving we met with very friendly helpful (but not pushy) staff who told us our room and over the course of our stay were more than happy to give restaurant recommendations, fax a letter free of charge, offer shawls at breakfast etc. The room are very nice -- not five star, but for the price, superb -- extremely clean and included quiet effective air conditioners, large bathrooms / showers/ T.V. (if u want one) couches, phone etc. The ultimate highlight was, one day -- after and exhausting walking trip and being caught in a thunderstorm, eating dinner on the terrace. They don't advertise this service well, but we thought -- from the wine bottle visible at breakfast -- that they had some sort of dinner (although we expected mediocre food, from a neighbourhood restaurant. instead they had perfect fresh bread, delish local appetizers (truly, the best we've had in istanbul) and a fabulous 'mushroom stew' that came out is a literally sizzling copper pot with lamb, onion, and melted mozzarella. (the english translations are not great, but rest assured all the food is fabulous!). This dinner (just my mum and I) solo on the terrace over the bosphorus drinking wine and enjoying the breeze was one of the most pleasant, relaxing nights weve had in istanbul. Highly recommended, and you must do the dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Charming in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: surfsideBBCA
Reviews.Content: Each morning we started our day with an unbelievable breakfast served on a rooftop overlooking the Bosphorus. The hotel manager was very accommodating and a wealth of knowledge when it came to helping us navigate the city or planning our daily activities. Nestled in a little neighborhood, its location was perfect for visiting the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Carpets72
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a neighborhood of many different ranges of hotel accommodations. The terrace and lovely breakfast are the best things about the hotel. The staff who clean the rooms are also excellent. When we arrived we were given a very nice room on the top floor, quite elegant. The problem was there were repairing/renovating the hotel and it sounded as if the jackhammer, saws, and other power tools were right in the room with us. At 6:30 pm when the noise persisted, we asked at the front desk for another room, away from the construction crew. We were told they had given us a very nice room, one of the nicest in the hotel, and they were 90 percent full and could not move us. We were told the noise would stop by 7 pm. It did not; in fact, it wasn't until after 9 pm that they finally stopped. The workers used the outside stairs to go up and down which was right next to our window and we were met with workers looking in the windows and vice versa. The next day I commented to the hotel staff member who I had spoken with the previous evening about the continuing noise. When I said we understood the hammering etc. would stop at 7 pm, the staff said, "I wouldn't know about that because my shift ends at 7 pm (!)" The next day we left early for a wonderful morning of sightseeing, and returned for a nap in the afternoon. Incredibly, the noise was even worse. We understand the problem of making necessary renovation, but we were paying 120 euros a night, and the clerk also told the day before that the work would be completed that same day. The clerk asked us if we wanted to make them shut down their construction crew which made us feel guilty. It was not a comfortable stay. The hotel should have made some reasonable accommodation or offered us an amenity.

Reviews.Title: “Just the hotel we were looking for - friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Englishtravelfanatic
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aruna We had an excellent long weekend. The management and reception staff were polite, friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and and to a good standard for a hotel in quite a central location. We could easily walk to the nearby station where frequent trains got us to the ferries. Being quite fit we also enjoyed walking to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sofia etc. Nearby were many restaurants so eating out locally was easy. I have to search to find things I could be critical about. Firstly I was disappointed that the fruit at the otherwise good breakfast was tinned (plenty of fresh fruit sold on markets) and secondly I think the downstairs rooms are rather dark and too close to reception. Had the weather been warmer we would have liked to have used the rooftop terrace. Check in to an upstairs room and you will have made a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, with personality and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lapland_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband in Aruna Hotel for 6 nights, and chose this hotel after reading the reviews here, and we were not disappointed! Service was warm and friendly, they really made us feel like home. This trip was a birthday present for my husband, and Mr. Yilmaz (the Manager) helped me to organize a little surprise for him, champagne and strawberries with cream to our room after a full day excursion on Bosphorus and Dolmabahce Palace. Our room was nice and clean, I could have used a littel larger wardrobe, but managed anyway. Breakfast was also good, and we could survive with that until dinner. Nice view from the roof terrace, where we used to have our coffees.. Location is perfect, a short walk to major sights, shops and restaurants. And itÂ´s easy to take the tram from Sultanahmet if you want to go further, and continue with metro. With the busy traffic, I recommend to take the tram, itÂ´s much faster than going by taxi. We had a great vacation in Istanbul, and it was always nice to go back to our hotel, share the experiences of the day with the hotel staff. I can strongly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul. Thanks to them!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but ask for a room at the back.”
Reviews.Author: lchellingworth
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel very much. Clean and comfortable with good beds, great breakfast and ideal location for the old city. Our triple room was on the third floor and faced the front of the hotel. Although the road is not heavily used, the cobbles amplify the sound of cars despite the double glazed windows. We would recommend that you ask for a room facing the back of the hotel or take earplugs. The staff were great and booked two excursions plus our transfers to and from the airport. Very helpful. This is our third visit to this great city and we would definitely return to the Aruna.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: djiman
Reviews.Content: Aruna Hotel was clean and as all the other reviews have mentioned the service and rooms were good. Thre rooms were clean and staff courteous. I initially had a room facing the road which was noisy due to the traffic but complained and was moved to a better room. Mr. Yilmaz - the manager was extremely co-operative and went out of his way to be helpful. Good hotel and service I would recommed anyone to book a room without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel with Superb service”
Reviews.Author: bellochicco
Reviews.Content: We will strongly recommend the hotel to any one -- business or leasure traveller. Very good location, excellent rooms (clean, fresh, full of day light and air) clean brand new bathrooms, very good breakfast and friendly front desk. What more do you need for youyr stay? Excellent restaurants around. Shops around are expensive. Suggest shopping in Grand Bazar! Tip: Do not miss Basilica Cistern (It is a wonder) and NEVER VISIT THOUSAND and ONE COLUMN CISTERN (it is really ugly).

Reviews.Title: “This proved to be an excellent recommendation fromTripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: NannyBAbingdon
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised by the good location, the extremely helpful staff, the cleanliness of the room and the lovely breakfasts. In fact I'm typing this from my hotel room right now using the free wifi, an unexpected bonus! The Aruna is a small hotel with only 16 rooms - great if, like us, you enjoy staying in a hotel with some character and personality. Don 't know about the other rooms but ours was fairly spacious and comfortable. We have no complaints, though there's not a lot of storage - just a small wardrobe - but luckily we don't have masses of clothes with us. Thank you to reviewers on tripadvisor for this brilliant recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJGSydney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aruna for 8 nights. This was our first time in Istanbul and we decided on the Aruna after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel was very nice. Yilmaz, the Manager, was very helpful and always keen to assist. The breakfast spread was very good - as was the coffee! The location is good. It is in a residential area so there is little street noise and as mentioned in previous reviews it is only a short walk to major sights, restaurants and shops. There is however little noise-proofing within the hotel so door-slamming and people coming back to the hotel late at night who don't seem to care about others who are sleeping, can be a problem. We had booked a suite and even though it was on the large side the space was not well-designed so seemed a little cramped and dark. Having said that, the bed was comfortable and the room was spotlessly clean. Despite the negative comments I have made we still thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Aruna and believe it is good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Oriental elegancy 5 minutes far from all the hotspots!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nikosargyros
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 nights and everything was perfect!Very nice comfortable and elegant rooms!Very helpfull the manager of the hotel he gave us all the information we wanted!The location was perfect just 5 minutes with foot from st sophia,top kapi palace,blue mosque,hippodrome,the roman cisterns and arasta bazaar.10minutes far from grand bazaar and the spice bazzar.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: eromenskiy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aruna hotel for 4 nights. The location was great, very close to tourist attractions (about 10 minutes walk to Blue mosque). Staff was very helpful with perfect english. We can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Destichado
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just few minutes walk from the major tourist sites in Sultanahmet, plenty of restaurants around it and the staff is attentive and careful. We stayed in a suite, which is neatly furnished with amenities. I also liked the tea/coffee making facilities, which were generously refilled daily by smiling and regardful chambermaid. The minibar prices are more then reasonable and sometimes lower then the outlets around the hotel. Free Wi-Fi internet is also a nice compliment. View from the rooms might put you off, but hey, who would go to Istanbul and stay in a room, while history and life boils 24/7 all over this full of symbols city.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Ntlie
Reviews.Content: Great stay, great location. We found this place through tripadvisor. It was a lovely 5-night stay in Istanbul. It wasn't the first time we were here but this was the best experience what we have ever had.. We arrived very early in the morning and we were surprised when we were told we could get the room at that time and no need to wait until afternoon. You can only know such a wonderful thing to check in early after over night flight. Breakfast was a gem that we loved to have every morning with plenty kinds of foods.. Staff was excellent as well as the other services of the hotel. We had all the information we needed from the front desk during our stay. Arranging the trips in the city and transfers etc... We highly recommend this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stecCanada
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aruna Hotel for a week in October 2009 with my husband and two daughters as well as my mother and father. We found the hotel staff a pleasure to interact with and the accomodation more than met our expectations. Altough the hotel seemed clean and well decorated to me, the new owner was busy refurbishing it, so I can only guess it will be even nicer in the future. It is a lovely mix of traditional turkish design and more modern ammenities. I chose this hotel because of it's great location - close to the Blue Mosque etc. as well as the ocean - and because it was one of the few I found with an elevator for my parents. We enjoyed the beautiful rooftop terrace every night and loved the breakfast buffet in the morning. And we really enjoyed the fact that it is a small hotel and we got to know the staff during our week stay, their helpfulness and genuine freindliness added greatly to our trip to Istanbul. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: mphrutra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Aruna in November, and it made our visit in Istanbul extremely comfortable. The room we had wasn't large, but extremely cozy, well furnished and brand new. The staff were extremely welcoming and accommodating. The breakfast was very good. The place has a diamond-in-the-rough feel to it, since it's small and has a five-star feel. Rarely do I not have a single complaint or issue with a hotel, but this was one of those few exceptions. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul, and certainly hope to stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: kkchoco00
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel with two other friends, and we had an incredible time. The room was wonderful (they gave us a free upgrade from a triple to a triple suite, which was perfect for the three of us), the service was very hospitable, and the breakfast was delicious - especially for the two of us vegetarians! The location is also quite nice, although it's a bit of a hike up a muddy hill, but if you take the "back" way (turn right when you leave the hotel and go up instead of turning left), it's a much more scenic walk and less steep. Definitely a hotel I would recommend to anyone considering smaller, cozier places to stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful trip in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: aibabar
Reviews.Content: It's been two days since I came back from my wonderful trip in Istanbul. I stayed in this lovely boutique hotel for 4 nights and I've been totally satisfied with my stay. It was a very clean hotel in a perfect location, walking distance to Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and Grand Bazaar. I had a very warm welcomed by the manager (Mr.YILMAZ and NAVSATand given essential information that I needed during my stay! All the hotel staff was very friendly and so warm to every guest in the hotel. I would like to send my special regards to Mr. TOLGA and MR.YILMAZ who helped me organizing my boat trip in the Golden Horn, Bosporus, and Dolmabache Palace! I would like to send my special thanks to Ms.Aytan for her warm welcome on breakfast every morning! I am planing to come back soon to Istanbul and if I do, I will stay at Aruna,and Highly recommended to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful week”
Reviews.Author: Denzil333
Reviews.Content: We used the Aruna hotel for a week in Nov.. We took a chance as we had not been there before and knew nothing about it. The gamble paid off as the location was spot on. The staff could not have been more helpful. Rooms were spotless and had fresh sheets everyday. We will be going back Den and Lori

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, perfect location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Rahmi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aruna hotel for 3 days (my plan was to stay one day, but the hotel was so great that I extended twice) and it was my first time in Istanbul. The location was perfect, very close to tourist attractions but quiet and specially the service of the manager Yilmaz was excellent: very helpful, spoke perfect English and he was very hospitable, gave a lot of tips and nothing was a problem. The next time I'm in Istanbul I will sure come here again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable & good value - perfect for main sites in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: NKSSutton
Reviews.Content: The Aruna Hotel is well situated and the staff are helpful. The Manager, Yilmaz Doruk, speaks perect English and arranged a taxi to pick us (cheaply) at the airport. He offered helpful advice, assisted me in phone calls and made good recommendations. The rooms are not large, but have everything you need - with good facilities. The breakfast was excellent. Although it was early November we enjoyed reading on the roof terrace in the sunshine, overlooking the Bosphorus, before coming back to a stormy and wet London. To be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Small friendly hotel run by people who genuinely want you to get the most out of your stay, located in an ideal position”
Reviews.Author: Tapsters
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were given some tips on excurtion ideas by the hotel manager Yilmaz, and sincerely told to ask if there was anything we needed. We always felt that we could ask for advice, or even just go to reception in the middle of the night if we wanted a chat about the city or anything (not that we did, but we certainly felt we could have). We were on the floor above reception in one of the smaller double rooms but it had plenty of space for hanging clothes and full length mirror which was a bonus. The bed was comfortable (hard, not springy) and en suite bathroom was very clean, with a good shower and lovely soap (olive oil and thyme). There was a small fridge in the wardrobe and safe deposit box there also, as well as some complementary hotel slippers. There were several choices of teas and t.v too. We didn't need it as it was autumn time, but there was also air conditioning in the room. Breakfast was served in a large room downstairs with a friendly family abience and an abundance of cold buffet choice (cereals, dried fruit, yoghurt, jams, honey, tarhini, olives, cheeses, cold meats) as well as some hot breakfast fare. However, if you ask for it, you can have fantastic fried eggs (usually 3 or 4!) or omelette and they will also make you Turkish coffee - although there is a machine on the buffet for guests to make their own espressos etc. The hotel is located in an area perfect for exploring Sultanahmet (the streets are cobbold in much of that area so high heels would be a nightmare), and for catching the tram to the other side of the Golden Horn - although we walked it. It is tucked just far enough away from the nearby touristic resturant area to be very quiet, at the same time near enough just to pop out in the evening if you wanted a short jaunt. There is a roof tarrace that looks right out over the sea of Marmara one way - fantasic at 6am to watch the sun rise over the mountains beyond - and up the hill to the Blue Mosque and Sophia the other way. (There is a lift to all floors including the terrace) There is a call to prayer from the nearby Blue Mosque (and others) at about 5.30 which is incredibly atmospheric, and beautiful but earplugs were useful to ensure unbroken sleep. Probably what we liked the best was the feeling that everyone who worked there enjoyed doing their job and wanted the guests to have an enjoyable relaxed time. Well done. We would definately recommend it to others who want a quiet comfortable hotel, and we definately want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: CarlA47
Reviews.Content: Excellent value. We stayed for 6 nights. The location is very good - within an easy walk of almost all of the top tourist spots and the tram. Some local restaurants are OK, but ask the manager for recommendations on better ones (still within walking distance). Our room was a corner room and quite large by European standards, the bathroom was clean, and - most important in August - the A/C worked really well. The best part might have been the included breakfast. Large quantities of fresh fruit every morning, hot eggs and meats, breads and pastries, good coffee. You can go until dinner with just a light snack for lunch. You can get to the Aruna from the airport cheaply on the subway and a tram, but try to look at a map before the first time you walk from the tram to the hotel as it's a bit tricky. Just ask directions for the "Arena" hotel if you get lost walking to the hotel. That's older and well-known, and the Aruna is just down the street from it.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected and more”
Reviews.Author: mdac
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent four nights at Aruna Hotel in Sultanahmet at the very beginning of November. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by Yilmaz, the manager. He took the time to sit down with us to get to know us a little better, find out what we were interested in doing and seeing during our short stay, and answer all of our questions about the area and attractions. I have to add that Yilmaz came across as very genuine and sincerely interested in informing us of all that the city has to offer a visitor. We arrived to the hotel early before check-in time so the staff placed our luggage in a secure room while we went out to see some of the sights. When we got back a few hours later, we were pleasantly surprised to find that Yilmaz had upgraded us from a deluxe double room to a suite, free of charge. I believe the suite we had is pictured on the hotel website (first two pictures from the left under the title "Aruna Suite"). The room was clean and equipped with a flatscreen TV, heater, AC with remote control, and a stocked-up mini-fridge. The room also had a safe but I couldn't seem to get it to work. When I asked downstairs, they told me I would be able to lock and unlock it using the extra key provided with the room key. I tried with the extra key, still no luck. However, this was not a real issue for us. The bed was made each day, fresh towels provided. Breakfast was great for us. They always had eggs, pastries, some type of meat, various kinds of cereal, bread, cheeses, cold cuts, juices, milk, and ALL kinds of fruit spreads. They also had this thing called halva, it's like a sugary cocoa spread, similar to Lebanese halawa. Oh, and they had an espresso machine. The area was quiet and safe; ten minutes away from Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, and Topkapi Palace; and near a number of restaurants...basically, all the praises mentioned in past reviews about the location are true. Also, one fact I didn't see mentioned in past reviews is that the hotel is situated about two and a half blocks away from the sea. If you're facing the hotel, turn right and walk straight until you pass another hotel and come across the first road that turns right. When you turn right, you'll come across the main road that borders the old area and the sea. Yilmaz made some recommendations for restaurants which turned out to be good and even got us in contact with some people he knew when we mentioned an interest in shopping for local leather goods. What also made this a great experience for us was the little details like when we were lent an umbrella when we weren't properly equipped for the weather. In short, we were extremely pleased with the hotel, staff, and approach to service and hospitality. Thank you so much, Aruna Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, obliging and friendly”
Reviews.Author: HotdogDave
Reviews.Content: We had to move hotels after two nights and chose the Aruna after reviewing it on TripAdviser and were not disappointed and stayed a further 4 nights. Although the room was slightly small it was very comfortable and well located if you don't mind a short walk up the hill to Sultanhamet where most of the major sights are located. There is a plethora of restaurants and bars just a short walk away. Although we had a room overlooking the street we found the area very quiet. Yilmaz, the front office manager was very obliging and helped us with anything we asked of him in a very efficient and professional manner. Whilst the breakfast buffet was not the spread that a North American may desire, it is typical of Turkey, fresh and plentiful and therefore a perfect part of the Istanbul experience. The Chef is a gem too.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as some of the reviews suggest...”
Reviews.Author: simbals1
Reviews.Content: Expectations were admittedly fairly high, given the favourable reviews in place. In summary, the hotel is good, but I suspect you can get better. Areas of comment are as follows: - we upgraded ourselves to a luxury room. The size of the room was great and we enjoyed our own TV area. AC worked well and most importantly the room was quiet. - whilst the room is furnished nicely, on closer inspection, we actually found it to be quite worn - light bulbs didn't work, wall paper falling away, attempts to paint over certain areas but not finished properly. hot water was not consistent. not really what you expect for Â£130 a night. - breakfasts are ok. on first inspection, you think it looks great. but the hot selection is poor and gives the impression that it's been standing for a long time. pastries don't seem fresh enough either. but the general selection of foods on offer, ranging from cerels, cheese, cold meats etc. is good. we did enjoy Abdullah's company at breakfast but after the 4th day of hearing the same jokes to other guests, including his attempts at getting people to speak basic Turkish, it got a bit tiresome to be honest. but i appreciate that some people will at the same time love it. - location is ok. it's in a very safe area and all the main sights are nearby. tram is about a 10 minute walk. however, restaurants in the area are generally fairly average. the best area is Istiklal / Galata - some great places. but it's a long-ish journey on the tram to get there, particularly at the end of the night. Hope it helps.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Vonsie
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in the Aruna for 5 nights. This included a free pick-up from the airport and a dinner one night. It is a very clean family run, recently refurbished hotel in a rustic style. It is located about 5 minutes from the Blue Mosque on cobbled streets with lots of restaurants etc. Some other reviewers mention the hilly road, which does slope upwards towards the city's attractions, but I was on a crutch and it was absolutely no problem and certainly isn't a negative. As we were three we had booked an extra bed, the hotel offered us the suite at no extra charge so we would have extra space which was good as from the twin room I saw it would have been a bit too cosy for 5 nights. The fold up bed wasn't great but to the hotel's credit they offered us an adjoining room at no extra charge if we wanted it. The staff were very helpful with all of our enquiries and the room was made up every day. It included a turkish bath/shower en-suite, kettle, minibar, safe, sat-tv etc. Breakfast was a range of olives, meats, cereals and some hot options, but we chose to pick up something on the run as much as the hotel. I think the hotel's biggest asset is the location, it is only a few minutes to the main sights and access to the rest of the city, yet off the beaten touristy track which was good for nice restaurants. In nice weather it is only 2 mins from the promenade which takes you all the way into town by the water.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: EitanIsrael
Reviews.Content: we stayed 5 nights at this great hotel. very clean , great service . breakfast and Abdulla service is great . we were sitting at night all alone on the roof top overlooking the Bosphoros and even without asking they brought us free of charge our favorite coffee - Abdulla remmembers what each one liked. on the down side -noise from the street can be very disturbing. the Moazin calls in the morning are very loud but this is anywhere in the old city and not much hotel can do about it. we always prefer to stay in the old town and not the new town location is great - 5 minutes walk from all attractions in the old city . this is our 5th time in Istambul and we know we found our hotel also for the next stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel in a Back Alley......”
Reviews.Author: barnetjbDHA
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is newly done and in great shape. It offeres a good breakfast/room rate for the area. The neighborhood of Sultanahmet is a backpackers' paradise with hostels, hookah bars and small food outlets for cheap. The street the hotel is on is out of the way and very narrow with lots of traffic. Be careful here at night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, friendly and relaxed hotel atmosphere in central location”
Reviews.Author: Reddevils73
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very clean, elegantly decorated and the staff are relaxed and friendly. There is a real family like atmosphere, no hard sell and staff are flexible and eager to help, offering honest opinions and advice. Breakfast is sumptious, large choice of foods, better than others that we have stayed in, such as Hotel Almina and Orient Express. This is by far the nicest hotel, about a 5-10 min walk from the Blue Mosque. Situated on cobbled streets, in the old town. Lovely restaurants nearby away from the main tourist drag. Stayed in room on the ground floor facing the street. It could be noisy in the mornings when you hear people dragging their cases along the cobbles, but don't let that put you off, as you will be out and about by then. TV showed lots of English channels, had a jacuzzi bath and fridge in room. Highy recommend. This truly was one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in. Our only issue is that we should have stayed their longer, definitely book again!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect size hotel with friendly, helpful staff, clean rooms and a great chef!”
Reviews.Author: tsuhara
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying 12 nights at the Aruna Hotel. We could not have ordered a better place to stay. The rooms are spotless and comfortable. The staff goes out of their way to make your holiday a wonderful experience.They gladly answer questions and organize anything you will need; rental cars, tours, restaurant reservations, tickets or suggestions for shopping. Each morning we had a fabulous breakfast on the rooftop terrace overlooking the blue water. The chef, Abdullah, is so personable, we wanted to bring him home with us. Needless to say we made friends and hated to leave such a fabulous city. We would stay at the Aruna again without hesitation .

Reviews.Title: “Familiar atmosphere and exquisite breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Rosmarilla
Reviews.Content: Aruna is a very nice hotel, close to the cultural and archeological area of Istanbul: Sultanahmet. If you're not traveling with a huge luggage and if you're planning a short permanence, standard rooms are perfect: not enormous but nice and with essential services available: very clean bathroom with comfortable shower, tv, air conditioning, table and chairs. Breakfast is delicious (beware: Italian point of view! ;-) ).You'll enjoy the terrace and will find many different food: both continental and Turkish specialties, like â€œborekâ€� (delicious puff pastry) or typical thick yougurt (curdistan must!). The best aspect of Aruna is its surprising familiar atmosphere, the staff will take care of you and make you feel at home. I want to mention a special thanks to Svetlana, extremely kind receptionist with great attitude for Italian language ;-); Nevzat who also help us in every need; Tolga: best English speaker of all, and very gentleman guy, and last but not least: Abdullah, responsible of breakfast and definitely the best attraction of Aruna, whichever is your age or nationality he'll going to come you're most affectionate friend at Aruna ;-) As regards the position, the hotel is about 7 minutes by walk from the tram stop, which goes along to the most interesting points of Istanbul. In one sentence: Aruna it's a good deal between price and quality. Beware: the area is full of hotels and also touristic restaurants, for eating I'd suggest to move a little bit beyond, and avoid expansive places (for ex. Bodrum restaurant, near Basilica Cistern).

Reviews.Title: “Our romantic getaway !”
Reviews.Author: byanka
Reviews.Content: We just returned 2 days ago from Istanbul and we already miss it . It was more that we could ever immagine. Was the first time when we traveled to turkey, me and my fiance, and everything impressed us so much, starting with the hotel. Aruna hotel is located in the old part of the city, on a quite street, very close to the Blue Mosque, The Sultan Ahmed Mosque as the turkish people call it, and Hagia Sophia, on one side and the seashore on the other, where you can enjoy the view of the Goldenhorn and the Bosphorus. The building is welcoming you with a nice marble lobby, a glass elevator and traditional decoration. Everybody there is very nice and welcoming, ready to help you as well as they can. The room was clean and spacious, as the bathroom as well. The breakfast was served every morning on a nice roof terrace watching towards the sea. Overall we enjoyed it there very much and we would like to return. Bia and Ali

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cozy hotel in the old center of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MovilaA
Reviews.Content: Located in the Old City of Istanbul, at two streets distance (500m) from the restaurants area and 1 km (10 min walk) from the touristic objectives, it is the best choice for quality/price value. The rooms are nicely decorated, in a traditional style, they have a small terrace on the top-roof and an other one in the interior court. The breakfast was buffet style, very good indeed. The staff is very nice/helpful, we had an reservation for a triple room and they upgraded us with a suite room. So Aruna hotel was a very good choice we warmly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MaxHongKong1
Reviews.Content: The only hic-up of my stay with the Aruna happened on my first day as I waited for the complementary car pick-up. It arrived almost two hours late and only then after I had made a couple of calls to the hotel. From that point on, howevever, everything went exceptionally well. The management is kind and efficient - Yilmaz and Svetlana at the front desk could not have been kinder. The rooms are clean and the breakfast buffet substnatial. And the hotel is brilliantly located - at the bottom of a hill and hence away from much of the hubub but only a few minutes' walk to the main sites such as the Aya Sophia. On the weekend it can be noisy because of the music emanating from other hotels. But at around 11.00 this stops. The rest of the week was fine.

Reviews.Title: “heaven in the old Istanbul!!”
Reviews.Author: mahamoud_othman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I picked this hotel just by reading the positive reviews, they were spot on. The location was perfect for us as it is situated in a quiet neighbourhood which is within walking distance from all the major attractions in Istanbul- the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia etc and of course the sea! The breakfast in the morning was always fabulous and sets you up for the day ahead! The rooms were cleaned thoroughly each day which was a great bonus and most importantly the staff were all absolutely brilliant, they were always ready to offer their assistance whenever they were required and they provided us with their much needed opinions with regards to the best places to visit. We are already planning our next holiday back to Turkey and we intend to stay at the Aruna Hotel as we just felt so welcomed. We definately recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: ski999
Reviews.Content: Trip got off to a great start with one of the warmest welcolme we have ever had to a hotel - and an upgrade to a suite room ...... Room was quiet, well furnished in Turkish style and spotlessly clean, bathroom had Turkish bath (don't worry, it had a shower as well!). Breakfast choice was vast for such a small hotel. Location was 10 minutes walk from Blue Mosque or sea and 5 minutes from restaurant area. Best thing about the hotel were the staff, all were friendly and could not do enough for the guests. Can recommend this hotel to anyone. Many thanks to all the staff for making our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: hellonuri
Reviews.Content: people are very very nice and kind. good quality of service. room and facility are perfect. breakfast is amaging. i hope to visit again as soon as i can. it was very nice xoxo

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, location and service”
Reviews.Author: faana
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel to everyone. Staff were brilliant, Svetlana at reception was extremely helpful. Had no problems at all. Location was ideal, 5 minutes from the sea and the blue mosque. Food was very nice, breakfast was the best meal of the day! If you're looking for a little family hotel with 4 star services, this is perfect. Felt like coming at the end of each day!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have picked a better boutique!”
Reviews.Author: EldaloClan
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, quiet neighbourhood - very friendly and helpful staff (big hello's to Svetlana, Yilmaz and Tolga from Yasmine and Yasser!) Cozy, yet spacious room for a couple with a 3 and 1yr old (toddler bed plus cot fit perfectly) Definitely will visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: laykii
Reviews.Content: Great servis and hospitalty. We couldn't have been treated better in this lovely boutique hotel. As we were told this place is really like a big family house rather than a small hotel (with its unique and professional staffs). Thank you for everything folks, all the best...

HotelInfo.Name: ARN Aruna Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Cankurtaran Mah. Ahirkapi Sok No:74, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
